page.title: 11THE COLES' FARM
page.content: The Coles' farm has got a dog called Badger and some calves. The calves are one year old.The calves were big for their age.The lambs were playing in their pens.The cows on the farm are Friesians. The chickens have trick eggs to make them lay eggs.The breed of sheep are BORDER LEICESTER crossed with Suffolk. There are some bees on the farm. The bees have one hive and they get in a crack. The cows have to be milked every day in the morning and maybe midday.{ {The cows eat grass silage and they sleep on straw. The sheep have to be sheered in summer so they are not so hot.The wool gets made into sheepskin rugs, coats, boots. The wool is also used for jumpers gloves scarfs and knitting wool. Sheep are very handy and useful.
